EmailTemplate.subject: Tech Tips - Troubleshoot Aspire 100 Cordless Handsets
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]>
Have you experienced power-down problems with your Aspire® 100 cordless handsets (part numbers 1492-F-020X-01 and 1541-F-020X-01)?
Recent testing and field experience have revealed issues with the latest Cabin Service Unit (CSU) software V.234 and handset firmware 903-003 revision 013. This firmware can cause the cordless handset to remain on, instead of powering off, after 10 minutes of inactivity. It stays powered and continues to reboot every 140 seconds after de-registration with the CSU until the battery is drained.
The handset will start charging the battery from zero percent on the next aircraft cabin power-up. This rebooting occurs because the back-up file on the SATCOM Configuration Module (SCM), PN 1492-E-8120, is erased shortly after being loaded.
While we work on a permanent solution, please refer to the recent Service Information Letter (SIL) D201707000039 for instructions on how to configure and back-up the SCM. This also references the procedure in SB-90406597 Rev A on how back-up your configuration into the SCM.
Please visit the MyAerospace <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/]]> portal to easily search for the following support documents.
